author: Nicole Goodkind, CNN Business
description: The Federal Reserve raised interest rates by three-quarters of a percentage point on Wednesday in an aggressive move to tackle white-hot inflation that is plaguing the economy, frustrating consumers and stifling the Biden administration.
title: Fed makes aggressive move to tackle white-hot inflation

title: Cost of living: Stock markets slide over global economy concerns

author: Katie Glueck
description: Worried about inflation and dissatisfied with President Biden, many moderate women have been drifting away from Democrats. Now the party hopes the fight for abortion rights will drive them back.
title: Will the Abortion Debate Keep Moderate Women in the Democrats’ Camp?

author: Katie Glueck
description: Democrats hope the fall of Roe v. Wade will jolt abortion rights supporters into action in midterm elections. But is it enough to turn voters’ attention away from inflation?
title: Supreme Court’s Abortion Decision Roils Midterm Elections

author: Reuters Editorial
description: Interest rates in the developed world lag far behind rising prices. That’s sent savers flocking to traditional safe havens to preserve their capital. Edward Chancellor says emerging-market currencies may prove to be the “least dirty shirt” for investors.
title: Breakout: Escaping inflation - Reuters.com
